Data Driven Two-Sample Test

ddst.twosample.test.Rd

Performs data driven smooth test for the classical two-sample problem. It is aspecial case of data driven test for k-samples. Detailed description of the test statistic is provided in Wylupek (2010).

ddst.twosample.test(x, ..., d_N = 12, c = 2)

Arguments

x

a list with two vectors or a single vector.
...

if x is a single vector, then the second vector is provided in the ...
d_N

an integer, number of coordinates that measure potential deviation from null hypothesis
c

a positive number, penalty for model selection rule. Section 5.1 in Wylupek (2010), suggest that a good choice is c = 2, when k = 2, and c = 2.3, when k >= 3.

References

Data-driven k-sample tests. Wylupek (2010) https://www.jstor.org/stable/40586684?seq=1

Examples

# H0 is true
x <- runif(80)
y <- runif(80)
t <- ddst.twosample.test(x, y)
t <- ddst.twosample.test(list(x, y))
t
#> 
#> 	Data Driven Two-Sample Test
#> 
#> data:  
#> W.T = 0.008543, l = NA
#> 
plot(t)

# H0 is false
x <- runif(80)
y <- rexp(80, 1)
t <- ddst.twosample.test(x, y)
t
#> 
#> 	Data Driven Two-Sample Test
#> 
#> data:  
#> W.T = 47.032, l = NA
#> 
plot(t)
